main event: Radar operators aboard a B-29 aircraft over the Gulf of Mexico detected unidentified objects making passes at high speeds on January 12, 1953.
interesting points: The objects were observed on radar with speeds estimated between 2,000 to 3,000 miles per hour,No visual sightings were made by the crew despite the radar detection,The objects appeared to orbit the B-29 aircraft,The radar operator noted three objects on the scope from all quadrants,The objects rapidly disappeared when coming within 20 miles of the aircraft.
witness description: Radar operator, Aircraft Commander, Navigator, and Bombardier of B-29 aircraft
